title: IcoGlyphs Documentation
description: This documentation provides information on how to use, design, and understand the icons in our library.

sections.title: Icon Meaning & Usage
sections.content: Understand the meaning behind each icon and how to use them correctly.

icons.name: Home
icons.description: Represents the homepage or main screen in an application.
usage_recommendations: Use this icon for main navigation links to the homepage.
Avoid using it for unrelated concepts like a 'dashboard'.

icons.name: Search
usage_recommendations: Place it in the top-right corner or in a search bar.
Avoid using it for unrelated actions like 'filtering'.

sections.title: For Designers
sections.content: Guidelines on how to create and contribute icons.

subsections.title: Icon Design Guidelines
subsections.description: Ensure consistency and readability in icon design.
guidelines: Icons should be designed on a 24x24px or 48x48px grid.
Use a 2px stroke width for line icons.
Maintain a consistent corner radius for rounded icons.
Ensure icons remain legible at small sizes.

subsections.title: Accepted Formats
subsections.description: We support multiple formats for icons.

formats.name: SVG
formats.description: Preferred format for scalability and flexibility.

formats.name: PNG
formats.description: Use for compatibility with older systems.

sections.title: API
sections.content: Learn how to integrate and use our icons in your projects.

subsections.title: Using the API
subsections.description: Our API allows you to fetch icons dynamically in different formats.

endpoints.description: Retrieve a list of all available icons.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Specify the format (svg, png, webp). Default: svg.

subsections.title: Installation
subsections.description: You can use our icons via CDN, NPM, or by downloading the assets.
